title: 109_hr996
content: The Act titled "Highway Reauthorization Tax Act of 2005" extends highway-related taxes and trust funds. The "Highway Reauthorization Tax Act of 2005" extends various taxes under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to 2011, including taxes on buses, special motor fuels, alcohol fuels, heavy trucks, trailers, tires, gasoline, diesel fuel, kerosene, and period tax. The "Highway Reauthorization Tax Act of 2005" extends taxes under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to 2011, including period tax, floor stocks refunds, and certain exemptions. The "Highway Reauthorization Tax Act of 2005" extends taxes under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to 2011, including period tax, floor stocks refunds, and certain exemptions. Amendments are made to the Highway Trust Fund and motorboat/small-engine fuel tax transfers, with changes in dates from 2005 to 2011 and 2006 to 2012. Conforming amendments are also made to the Land and Water Conservation Fund Act of 1965. The Water Conservation Fund Act of 1965 is amended to change dates from 2003 to 2009 and from 2004 to 2010. The Highway Trust Fund is extended and expenditures are expanded, with changes in dates from 2005 to 2009. The Highway Trust Fund is amended to authorize payments under the Transportation Equity Act: A Legacy for Users. The Mass transit account is also amended to change dates. The Highway Trust Fund is amended to authorize payments under the Transportation Equity Act: A Legacy for Users, with changes to dates and exceptions to limitations on transfers. The Highway Trust Fund is amended to authorize payments under the Transportation Equity Act: A Legacy for Users, with changes to dates and exceptions to limitations on transfers, including amendments to the Aquatic Resources Trust Fund. The Highway Trust Fund is amended to authorize payments under the Transportation Equity Act: A Legacy for Users, with changes to dates and exceptions to limitations on transfers. Amendments made by this section will take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act. SEC. 3. Technical corrections for highway-related taxes. Amendments related to the American Jobs Creation Act of 2004 involve changes to the Internal Revenue Code, including adjustments to aviation fuel taxes and designations of subsections. The amendments made by this section will set the aviation fuel tax rate at 4.3 cents per gallon. The effective date of these changes will be retroactive to the American Jobs Creation Act of 2004.
